DESCRIPTION: The data provided by the "Database of Eurasian Phonological Inventories".
The data provided by the Phoible project.
The data provided by the "Global Linguistic Database" (Ruhlen 2008) as it was prepared by Creanza et al. (2015).
The data provided by the PBase project which was collected for the study of Mielke (2008).
The data provided by the LAPSYD database.
The data offered by the Nidaba web application.
The data presented on the Multimedia IPA Chart by the Department of Linguistics at University of Victoria.
The online version of the Index Diachronica, which is no longer available in its original form.
Sound class model (produced in a semi-generative manner with help of LingPy) following List (2014).
Sound class model (produced in a semi-generative manner with help of LingPy) following the ASJP (Wichmann et al. 2016) as used in List (2014).
Sound class model (produced in a semi-geneative manner with help of LingPy) following Dolgopolsky (1964) as used in List (2014).
Simple consonant-vowel-tone sound class model provided by LingPy (List et al. 2017).
A numeric account of sonority based on LingPy as presented in List (2014) and List et al. (2017)
A simple color-scheme based on Dolgopolsky's sound classes, used in LingPy.
The inventories given in the Fāngyán Cíhuì (Beijing Daxue 1964).
